moves.15. Qxd6 Qxd6 16. Rxd6 Nf8 17. Nc5 Nd8 1: White is a pawn up and therefore very happy to accept and encourage exchanges.
moves.24... Rxd1+ 25. Kxd1: An endgame occurs. Bishop v knight and white is a pawn up.
moves.25... Nd6 26. b3 Kf8 27. Kd2 b4 28. Bf1: The idea of this sacrifice is that if the black king gets in the corner it will be a draw. The position looks bad for black anyway.
moves.39... fxe4 40. Kxd6 exf3 41. Kxe5 Kb7 42: The lost pawn queens. I suspect all lines were lost after my king was decoyed away from the centre but my continuation wasn't the best attempt to save the half point.
